content.rendered:
It seems that, at times the world tries to put us all in a mold, to make us all the same. Other times, it seems that we are judged because we don’t meet certain standards. Yet, it’s those who discover who they are, the ones that really stand out in a positive way that rise to the top.

I cannot say that I am the best, the smartest, the fastest at anything. Whatever I do, there is always going to be someone who is better than I am. I can only say that, perhaps, I am better today than I was yesterday.

As a photographer, and someone who looks at other people’s photographs, it can be easy to think that it’s the camera that makes a great photograph. If I only had the same camera, I could take better pictures. But a camera doesn’t make a great picture any more than high quality makes a work of art or a masterfully written poem.

No, it seems that there is something else that makes me — and my photographs — different. And it’s not anything that you could see by looking at me. What makes me different is my unique way of seeing the world around me. It’s the thoughts that stir in my mind and eventually come out as a photographic image, that may or may not be exactly as I anticipated. It begins with an idea, but it comes from my unique perspective. In that way, we are all unique.
